text: The Council on Foreign Relations is a United States independent nonpartisan nonprofit organization, think tank, and publisher that was founded in 1921 and that is meant to help educate people (both Americans and foreigners) about foreign affairs. The Council on Foreign Relations talks about both the United States's foreign policy problems and other countries' foreign policy problems. It is also in charge of the journal Foreign Affairs, which it has published ever since 1922. ==References== Category:1921 establishments in the United States Category:Non-profit organizations of the United States Category:Think tanks based in the United States
title: Council on Foreign Relations
